page.title: 17BOLD HEATH.
page.content: The area that our particular group surveyed was Bold Heath. It is a distinct little settlement containing a few houses a public house and a disused school. It has an area of about 0.1 km squared and is bounded by a triangle of roads. The settlement is divided by a fast main road which, whilst being a main arterial, carries a sufficiently low volume of traffic as to be no real barrier to pedestrians crossing. During our survey we did a litter count and discovered that there was very little. Buildings within the area include an ex-Shell garage now operating as a restaurant, a garden centre, a post office built in 1717, a public house, a disused school and about 25 houses of an upper-middle class appearance. The area is regarded as desirable by the locals,the only drawback,the road.
